thread.title: Mama June undergoes 'most shocking transformation in reality TV history' -- she's a size 4 now!
thread.title_full: Mama June undergoes 'most shocking transformation in reality TV history' -- she's a size 4 now!

title: Mama June undergoes 'most shocking transformation in reality TV history' -- she's a size 4 now!
text:
Mama June undergoes 'most shocking transformation in reality TV history' -- she's a size 4 now! Mama June is about to go through "the most shocking transformation in reality TV history."
In a brand new teaser for her new WE tv show, "Mama June: From Not to Hot," the former "Here Comes Honey Boo Boo" star struggles as she attempts to transform her looks, her habits and her love life. The show premieres on WE tv on Feb. 24.
SEE ALSO: Chelsea Handler trolls Trump with head-turning White House snap 
"In the past year, we have seen the impossible become possible," an announcer says in the new video. "Can Mama June actually be a size 4?"
The beginning of the dramatic trailer shows Mama June weigh in at 352 lbs. before a super-cut of her working out, struggling with her eating and having emotional talks with the rest of her family members about undergoing weight loss surgery.
See photos of Mama June and Honey Boo Boo: 

"This surgery is the scariest thing I've ever done," she declares. "There is a skinnier person inside of me."
Throughout the two-minute teaser, the reality TV star looks noticeably more glam and skinnier at points, though it mostly focuses on her struggle to lose weight and the ramping up of her dating life.
"I'm changing my body and my love life," she says as she scrolls through a dating app at one point. "I'm about to start the biggest transformation of my life."
One thing's for sure -- we can't wait to see what she looks like now.
Watch the teaser below:
More from AOL.com: 
Jamie Lynn Spears' daughter, Maddie, has left the hospital after her ATV accident 
Michelle Obama to be guest judge on Gordon Ramsay's 'MasterChef Junior' 
Kelly Rowland reveals plans to tour and release an album this year
